tasks.task: Run a meat and egg CSA on a farm in southeast Indiana.
subtasks: Know the local market and adapt the CSA size to the community's needs.
Recruit CSA members through various means, including word of mouth.
Organize events like tree plantings and potlucks for CSA members.
Collaborate with other farms for technical and financial support.
Participate in local farmers markets, restaurants, and independent groceries.
Raise a diverse range of livestock including meat chickens, laying hens, sheep, pigs, and turkeys.
Operate a processing facility for meat and eggs on the farm.
Address challenges in scheduling processing dates with local butchers.
Develop a feasibility study for on-farm processing facilities with grant funding.
Generate additional value-added products despite their current development stage, e.g., jerky.
Use SAR grants to innovate in the farming sector, sharing knowledge with other farmers.
Balance environmental and economic goals in farm operations.

tasks.task: Apply for and manage SAR grants for innovative farming practices.
subtasks: Identify innovative practices relevant to their state or region.
Collaborate with other farms to increase grant funding.
Conduct research and share findings through various mediums.
Measure the financial viability of proposed projects.

tasks.task: Operate a vegetation-free CSA model focusing on non-perishable items.
subtasks: Choose appropriate products for the non-perishable CSA.
Promote the benefits of freezing non-perishable items to CSA members.
